page.title: 17LOCAL HISTORY PAISLEY
page.content: On this page is explained the origin of the place names of some of the districts of Paisley and Glasgow and what these areas are like now. {TODHOLM}was the " Field of the Fox" though a holm was originally an islet or a field with water on at least two of its sides. This is now a busy road with council housing on either side. {HUNTERHILL}is probably so called because the Steward's chief huntsman lived there.It is now a council housing scheme. {THORNLY}is the Thorn Lea or meadow, the meadow where the thorn trees stood. It is now a area of private housing. {CARRIAGEHILL}probably refers to a right the local monks had to the service of a carriage up the hill, from their tenants.It is now an area of private housing.
